words.definition: Actually means in fact or really.
words.example: My dad looks a little mean, but actually heâ€™s very kind.

words.definition: Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.
words.example: The boy took a big bite out of his hamburger.

words.definition: The coast is the land by an ocean.
words.example: I stayed on the southern coast of Australia.

words.definition: A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.
words.example: I made a deal with the other company to give us some money.

words.definition: The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.
words.example: Not many plants grow in the desert.

words.definition: An earthquake is a shaking movement of the ground.
words.example: The building shook during the earthquake.

words.definition: If something is effective, it works well.
words.example: Swimming is an effective way to stay healthy.

words.definition: To examine something is to look at it carefully.
words.example: The doctor examined my eyes today.

words.definition: If something is false, it is not correct.
words.example: If you think the answer is false, press the red button.

words.definition: A gift is something you give someone.
words.example: Dave received many gifts for Christmas.

words.definition: Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.
words.example: After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger.

words.definition: To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.
words.example: Sally imagined herself winning lots of money.

words.definition: A journey is a long trip.
words.example: I went on a journey across the country with my parents.

words.definition: A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.
words.example: The question was a puzzle to him.

words.definition: Quite is used to say that something is complete or very much.
words.example: I think typing on a keyboard is quite easy.

words.definition: Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.
words.example: I would rather have the red one than the blue one.

words.definition: If something is specific, it is precise or exact.
words.example: Please choose a specific place on the map.

words.definition: A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.
words.example: I took a tour of Asia and Europe.

words.definition: A trip is a journey to a certain place.
words.example: Ken took a trip to the city yesterday.

words.definition: If something has value, it is worth a lot of money.
words.example: Matthew found a treasure of very high value.
